meanings.definition: To decide or announce that a planned event will not take place
meanings.sent2: The school cancels classes on snow days.
meanings.sent3: The canceling of the party left everyone disappointed.
meanings.sent4: Her apology cancels out any hard feelings.
meanings.sent5: The cancellation of the flight was a huge inconvenience.

meanings.definition: To mark or perforate (a postage stamp) to show that it has been used
meanings.sent1: Please cancel the stamp on the envelope.
meanings.sent2: The post office cancels stamps to prevent reuse.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally cancels the stamp with a smudge.
meanings.sent4: The cancellation mark on the stamp is clear.
meanings.sent5: The cancellation of the stamp indicates its validity.

meanings.definition: To neutralize or counteract the effect of something
meanings.sent1: Eating a banana cancels out the sour taste.
meanings.sent2: Drinking milk can cancel the spiciness of food.
meanings.sent3: His joke cancels the tension in the room.
meanings.sent4: Her smile cancels out any negativity.
meanings.sent5: The medicine cancels the pain quickly.
